title: Who are the ghosts who haunt Holby City’s Ric Griffin, and does he die?
text:
Ghostly visions? (Picture: BBC)

Ric Griffin (Hugh Quarshie) faces a stark and terrible choice: treat his brain tumour with drugs and sit at home fading away, unable to work, eventually being confined to bed – or take the high-risk surgery offered by Max McGerry (Jo Martin), an operation that’s never been successfully tried on a human being and which could leave him either dead or severely impaired. ‘See how many words you can string together once she’s done with you,’ as Serena (Catherine Russell) put it, with gut-wrenching honesty.

At the end of tonight’s episode Ric’s mind was made up. He would go for the surgery. ‘I’m choosing life,’ he told Serena, because ‘if I can’t be a surgeon, what is the reason for my existence?’ Whether he survives the procedure is unclear at this point. All we know for sure is that the autumn trailer didn’t end well, with Ric’s heart stopping during surgery as an anguished Serena tried to keep him alive.

The trailer also features some characters who might be memories, visions, hallucinations or angels. They’re the ghosts that Ric spoke of at the end of this episode, the ‘ghosts that still haunt me.’ For a few moments we were inside Ric’s mind, hearing him think about Leo: ‘I should have realised something was wrong.’ He also thought about Diane: ‘I wasn’t there when she needed me the most.’ But who are Diane and Leo, the ghosts who still haunt Ric after so many years?

Leo Griffin was Ric’s son. Played by Junior Laniyan in 2002-3 and Daon Broni in 2004, Leo was a promising medical student whom Ric thought would go on to a great career as a CT surgeon. Leo and Ric had a turbulent relationship and when Leo died of a heroin overdose in series 10 Ric reproached himself for not being more involved in his son’s life. It’s something that has been a deep source of regret to him ever since.

Regrets… he’s had a few (Picture: BBC)

Diane Lloyd (Patricia Potter) worked at Holby City from 2002 to 2007 and right from the beginning she had a connection with Ric Griffin – it was revealed she was his ex-girlfriend. The relationship between them was on-and-off for the whole time she was in the show, although both of them had other relationships. Diane was even married to obstetrician Owen Davis, but in a special episode set in Ghana she and Ric rekindled their feelings for each other. Their relationship finally ended when Ric introduced Diane to his fiancée Thandie.

Diane’s life took a downward spiral and she was killed when her car was hit by a train, in an incident that was ruled as suicide. Following this, Thandie accused Ric of still being in love with Diane and he didn’t deny it. Ric went to say goodbye to Diane in the chapel of rest in a scene which Hugh Quarshie recently described as the saddest moment he’s had to film in his long Holby career.

So it’s clear that the deaths of these two important people in his life have always troubled Ric and as he reflects on his own mortality they’re very much in his thoughts. But will their appearance mean forgiveness and peace for him – or does it mean he’s about to join them in the afterlife?
